Html:
The typescript plugin is not picked up by Visual Studio 2013 after installation.

On my pc, I've removed Visual Studio 2012 and the old typescript plugin.
I've installed Visual Studio 2013 Ultimate (released today on MSDN version "12.0.21005.1 REL") and the Typescript for Visual Studio plugin which the IDE links to.

Visual Studio keeps showing "Install the latest Typescript for Visual Studio" when I try to create a typescript project. Adding a typescript file under Add > New Item is also missing.

I've tried cleaning VS 2013 back off the machine, rebooting and re-installing to no avail.
I've tried uninstalling the Typescript plugin several times and reinstalling.

I also installed the Python plugin as a test as it also said "Install Python for Visual Studio" - that worked - once it was installed and VS restarted, 7 python projects are available.

The Installed Products list also updated after python, no mention of Typescript here


This is the current installed products

Hi guys,

I had the same problem after uninstalling the RC versions of VS and installing the RTM version.

I figured VS RC uninstall might have left some remains of the previous plugin installation, so I uninstalled Typescript and then searched for 'Typescript' in 'Program Files (x86)' and found some suspicious looking folders hanging around in some Visual Studio folders. Sorry I can't remember the exact paths, but I was a bit pressed to get the thing working. After this I deleted those folders, re-installed Typescript and voila, it was working again.

Once again sorry for the sketchy instructions, but hope it enough to help you guy.

VC

Hi Vcastro70

Some good advice there. I did find some old folders which I cleaned. Unfortunately, its still not detecting the plugin.
At this point bar a machine wipe or go back to VS2012, I can't think what to do.

Hopefully newer versions of the plugin can correct the problem.

Edit: Tried the following, I give up now
  • I deleted the previous download of the typescript plugin in the downloads folder
  • Uninstalled it
  • Cleaned all references to it
  • Started VS 2013
  • Went to New Project > Typescript
  • Clicked the button to get the download
  • It opened chrome
  • I installed it
  • VS 2013 doesn't register the installed, still says to download it

Hello Solyad,

I think I've also found some old stuff lying around in some folder inside %APPDATA% which I also removed.
One more information though, after I successfully managed to get the plugin working, whenever I create a new Typescript language project, in the New Project dialog I still get the 'Install latest Typescript version' option, although I now have an actual project template to choose from, and when I open an existing project all is working properly.

There is a few bits showing in temp in appdata. Ill clean that too.
Thanks
John

Still no joy. I've cleaned every reference on the machine, bar hunting through the registry.
When I try to do a new project, it just creates an empty folder. Its just not working.
Bugged product, life should not be this hard. VS2013 is just out so hopefully theres a fix.

Thanks for all the suggestions
I have same issue with VS2013 RTM, TypeScript Plugin 0.9.1 or 0.9.1.1

Hello Solyad

I found a way, my VS2013 is installed in driver D, but the plugin is installed in C, so copy items about TypeScript in C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Visual Studio 12.0\Common7\IDE\ProjectTemplates and ItemTemplates, and copy them to the right folder in D.


Delete the ProjectTemplatesCache and ItemTemplatesCache, so VS can reload TypeScript items you just added.


Hope this helps

Hi Zxcp

Ah, my installation is also split across two drives. This might be it.
I will try your solution this evening. Fantastic tip.

Perhaps the plugin just can't handle split installations at the moment.

Much appreciated
John
Sounds like there is an issue that was recently fixed around installing TypeScript when VS was installed to a non-standard location. This should be fixed in the next release.

Hello zcxp,
Your solution helped me. I installed VS on my SD drive. Once I cut and pasted the TypeScript folders to C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Visual Studio 12.0\Common7\IDE\ProjectTemplates and ItemTemplates and also delete the cache folders, it all works. Hopefully people will read this and not go down the path of re-installing their environment.

Thank you,
Billy

Hi

It fixed it for me also.

Thanks
